posts.author: Kyhe
posts.content: Hey, im building a rogue wizard on a pre epic server, wanting to Dualwield, how Many lvls Would you take In rogue vs wizard? Got 18 dex and 16 int, putting the extra points towards int. Im already up two rogue lvls

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'd restart if I were you.  Starting with 18 DEX is putting you in a hole.  You also failed to mention the race.  It should be elf.  Neither human nor gnome reaches as high an AB.  Halfling results in XP penalty.  Elf will also provide a full martial weapon selection over the small races.

The best ability spread for a DWing stealth (dexer) spellsword would be STR 14, DEX 17 (22), CON 12, WIS 8, INT 16, CHA 8.

You will need at least 12 feats for a decent pre-epic spellsword and rog/wiz won't cut it.  Your optimal split will be Wiz12/Ftr4/Rog4.  The list of feats you will need:

Blind Fight, Wpn Finesse
WF/WS/ImpCrit: some finessable
Ambidexterity/TWF/ITWF
KD/IKD
Extend/Empower Spell

I'm estimating something like Conc 23(24), Disc 23(25), Hide 21(27), Lis 21(22), Mv Sil 21(27), Spcr 22(25), Tumb 20(26) with a few points left for UMD.  You'll need to space your tumble and discipline dumps out as evenly as possible for ideal playability.

Even with the BAB boost from fighter levels, the highest APR you will reach is 5 while DWing, 6 hasted.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Halfling will not get an xp penalty in a rogue/wizard build, and will even get an extra AB point from small stature. But a halfling will be restricted to tiny weapons (like daggers) if you want to dual-wield.
The advice from Hip is valid if you want a spellsword. Things will be much easier if you want something like an "arcane trickster" that can focus on magic and rogue skills.
Another point is that in a pre epic build, the effect of arcane spells on AB and defence will even let a mage be a decent melee character á la the "Melee Mage"

posts.author: Kyhe
posts.content: i catch your drift Hip, and i understand what you mean. with that said, i think im going more for the arcane trickster idea that mick mentions and thought a hafling build with TWF would be fun for that idea

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Have a look at this build and see if you can use it. It has level 9 spells and rogue skills. Wizard has spells for opening locks and disarming traps. They also have invisibility spells, so if you don't want stealth skills, you can take pickpocket and a social skill like persuade instead. A pixie familiar will add to the rogue part.
The dual wielding costs 3 feats (5 if you sum up all combat feats), but doubles the number of attacks per round. The AB is not impressive by any standard, but you should at least be able to fight some mobs if you buff up.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Neither Blind Fight nor ImpCrit: Dagger.  Ouch!

Not sure how much Expertise mode will get used. If the toon has trouble hitting anything DWing at +14/+9/+14/+9, it'll do nothing at all at +9/+4/+9/+4 hoping to roll a 20.  Unless the plan is to just buff with Empowered Endurance, whatever DR spell is handy and all recipro shields... then just stand there healing while the shields do the damage.  Trying to cast offensively within melee range will just result in multiple AoOs anyway.  Not a pleasant scenario.

I'd say this build needs to stack deadly traps... desperately.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
@ Hip: The OP wanted a rogue/ wizard. I have given wizard priority in this build. In a preepic environment the DR spells and reciproke shields are very strong. Expertise is there primarily for casting, hopefully to make the DR spells last longer.
If you want to fight: With GMW and empowered cat's the AB bonus becomes +22/+17/+22/+17. The main damage comes from weapon enhancements (GMW , Flame weapon) and empowered Bull's. Flame weapon is an on hit effect, and Imp crit will only effect the damage from the weapon. This is not a spellsword, but the weapons are not there only to look cool. I pointed at fighting mobs if need be.
